ui.dialogs

Class Scale3DDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Dialog
            • javax.swing.JDialog
              • ui.dialogs.Scale3DDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.WindowListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class Scale3DDialog
extends javax.swing.JDialog
implements java.awt.event.WindowListener
    The Scale3DDialog class is responsible for the dialog box that appears when the user selects the 'Change Window Ranges...' option in the Graph Options menu of a 3D graph panel. It prompts the user for the minimum and maximum range values for the x, y, and z axes, and then makes the appropriate changes to the Plot3DPanel's ranges. Key listeners are implemented to cause the graph to update in real-time as the user edits the range values. This class is separate from the ScaleDialog class because the plot panels they modify/access are of a different nature. Scale3DDialogs are meant to interact with JMathTool Plot3DPanels, whereas ScaleDialogs are meant to interact with ODE Toolkit PlotPanels. Therefore, although the UIs are essentially the same, their functionality is completely different.
    Author:
    Andres Perez 2009, modified by Clinic 10-11
    See Also:

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Scale3DDialog(Graph3DPanel owner)
      The constructor sets the graph and plot panel owner, and then initializes all the elements in the dialog box, adds the listeners, and adds the components to the dialog box using a GridLayout, and adds a Window Listener to the dialog box window.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Scale3DDialog

        public Scale3DDialog(Graph3DPanel owner)
        The constructor sets the graph and plot panel owner, and then initializes all the elements in the dialog box, adds the listeners, and adds the components to the dialog box using a GridLayout, and adds a Window Listener to the dialog box window.
        Parameters:
        owner - the Graph3DPanel associated with the scale dialog

    • Method Detail

      • storeOriginalRanges

        public void storeOriginalRanges()
        This function stores a copy of all the ranges. It is called whenever the dialog box is opened so that the values are able to be returned upon canceling the dialog.

      • updateFields

        public void updateFields()
        This function updates the range values for the dialog box's input. It is called any time the ranges are changed by anything other than the input fields. It sets the values to the current ranges of the Plot3DPanel.

      • setAutoScale

        public void setAutoScale(boolean autoScaleOn)
        This function is called by the SetAllAutoScale function in Graph3DPanel to update the status of auto-scaling in the dialog box. If set to on, the check box is selected, the manual ranges are stored (in case the user activates auto-scaling from the dialog), and the input fields are disabled. If set to off, the check box is de-selected, the manual ranges are restored (in case the user de-activates auto-scaling from the dialog), and the input fields are enabled.
        Parameters:
        autoScaleOn - true if auto-scaling is activated
